title.narrative: INL Travel Grant to attend ISSUP Conference Min o

description.narrative: INL Travel Grant to attend ISSUP Conference Min of Edu Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

title.narrative: Conservation of the Mid-19th-Century Shwe Nan-Daw Teak Wood Monastery in Mandalay

description.narrative: One of few historic landmarks to survive the World War II bombing of the former royal capital of the Burmese kingdom in 1945, the building is susceptible to irreversible damage from water infiltration and other threats. This project includes documentation, structural stabilization, conservation training, and the development of a maintenance program.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement
International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement

title.narrative: Trafficking in Persons, Phase 2

description.narrative: Through this program, World Vision aims to strengthen comprehensive reintegration support for victims of trafficking in Burma through a coordinated local, regional, and national approach. Objectives include improving comprehensive services for identified victims of trafficking; and creating results-driven community, subnational, national, and regional networks empowered to combat human trafficking. The program will operate in townships in Yangon, Mandalay, Ayeyarwaddy Regions, and Shan Stateall of which have either been identified as hotspots for human trafficking or areas with high levels of internal migration. This program will build off of prior anti-trafficking programs in Burma, including Trafficking in Persons (TIP) Office programming and the Australia-funded Australia-Asia Partnership against TIP, by scaling efforts to reach more survivors and further bridge the gap between local civil society and national-level government officials. This project will work with the government (central and local) and civil society organizations to help foster cooperation between the two. It will also provide some support to the government on building capacity for protection issues. This will include holding coordination workshops to which government and civil society stakeholders will be invited, and direct training on victim protection to the Department of Social Welfare as well as NGO service providers.

Department of State, Migration and Refugee Assistance
Department of State, Migration and Refugee Assistance

title.narrative: Burma Anti-Trafficking in Persons project

description.narrative: World Vision will improve victim-centered investigations and prosecutions through training and support to police, judges, prosecutors, and case managers. The project will strengthen protection and reintegration services for victims of trafficking in Burma; address gaps in existing training programs; provide reintegration support; increase the capacity of a local partner to help insure sustainability; support police trainers in training of additional police; develop, test, and implement a prosecution module for Case Management Training, and train case management stakeholders; respond to the individual reintegration needs of victims; and support shelter visits to Thailand to screen victims of trafficking before they return to Burma.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Conservation of the Mid-19th-Century Teak Wood Shwe-nandaw Kyaung (Monastery) in Mandalay, Phase 2

description.narrative: Shwe nan-daw Monastery is the only remaining structure of the former royal palace in Mandalay. This project, which completes conservation work begun under a previous Ambassadors Fund grant, directly supports the U.S. embassys efforts to promote a better understanding of U.S. policies, culture, and values and to develop and strengthen the U.S. embassys working relationship with the Burmese government.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Documentation of the Early 19th-Century First Baptist Church in Mawlamyine

description.narrative: Though the architecture of the church is Western in design, the materials and building methods used in its construction stemmed from Burmese craft traditions, resulting in a masterful blend of Burmese and Western styles. This project includes a condition survey, conservation plan, and site documentation.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Building a National NGO Network to Combat Trafficking, Especially in Conflict and Ceasefire Areas in Myanmar

description.narrative: IOM is enhancing victim protection efforts in Burma by increasing the capacity of a national network of non-governmental organizations (NGO) to (1) better engage in and support Burmas counter-trafficking response, and (2) increase the geographic coverage of reintegration assistance. This project is guiding anti-trafficking actors in Burma to build partnerships with local and international NGOs, prioritize and significantly increase victim identification and protection efforts, and develop and implement referral procedures.

title.narrative: INL Travel Grant to attend ISSUP Conference

description.narrative: INL Travel Grant to attend ISSUP Conference Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement

title.narrative: Conservation of Early 19th-Century First Baptist Church in Mawlamyine, Phase 2

description.narrative: The early 19th-century First Baptist Church in Mawlamyine is a masterful blend of Burmese craft traditions and Western architectural styles. The project, which continues work begun under a previous Ambassadors Fund grant, directly supports the U.S. embassys efforts to promote national reconciliation, respect for religious and ethnic diversity, and training in the detection and safe removal of asbestos in historic buildings.
